Class GameController

java.lang.Object
application.controller.GameController
public class GameController extends Object
Central orchestrator that owns the game model and manages all threads. 
 ┌─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┐
 │                     THREADING ARCHITECTURE                             │
 ├─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┤
 │                                                                         │
 │   ┌──────────────┐   ConcurrentLinkedQueue   ┌──────────────────┐      │
 │   │  JavaFX App  │ ──── (input actions) ────► │  Game Loop       │      │
 │   │  Thread (UI) │                            │  Thread (~60Hz)  │      │
 │   │              │ ◄── Platform.runLater() ── │                  │      │
 │   │  - Key input │       (render updates)     │  - Drain queue   │      │
 │   │  - Rendering │                            │  - Apply actions │      │
 │   │  - Scene mgmt│                            │  - Check state   │      │
 │   └──────────────┘                            └──────────────────┘      │
 │                                                                         │
 │   ┌──────────────────┐    ┌──────────────────┐                         │
 │   │  Gravity Thread   │    │  Boss Animation   │                        │
 │   │  (variable rate)  │    │  Thread (500ms)   │                        │
 │   │                   │    │                   │                        │
 │   │  - Auto-drops     │    │  - Toggles boss   │                        │
 │   │    piece by        │    │    sprite frames  │                        │
 │   │    enqueueing     │    │  - Platform.       │                        │
 │   │    "moveDown"     │    │    runLater() to   │                        │
 │   │    into queue     │    │    update sprite   │                        │
 │   └──────────────────┘    └──────────────────┘                         │
 │                                                                         │
 │   ┌──────────────────┐                                                  │
 │   │  Boss Attack      │                                                 │
 │   │  Thread (varies)  │                                                 │
 │   │                   │                                                 │
 │   │  - Calls boss.    │                                                 │
 │   │    chooseAttack() │                                                 │
 │   │    .execute(board)│                                                 │
 │   │  - Platform.      │                                                 │
 │   │    runLater() to  │                                                 │
 │   │    re-render      │                                                 │
 │   └──────────────────┘                                                  │
 │                                                                         │
 │   Shared State:                                                         │
 │   - volatile GameState state  (MENU/PLAYING/PAUSED/WIN/LOSE)           │
 │   - volatile boolean running  (master kill switch for all threads)      │
 │   - Board, Boss, Tetromino    (accessed via synchronized blocks)        │
 │   - ConcurrentLinkedQueue     (lock-free input queue)                   │
 │                                                                         │
 │   Pause Mechanism:                                                      │
 │   - ESC key → state = PAUSED                                           │
 │   - All threads check state in their loop:                              │
 │       while (running) {                                                 │
 │           if (state == PAUSED) { Thread.sleep(100); continue; }         │
 │           // ... normal work ...                                        │
 │       }                                                                 │
 │   - Resume → state = PLAYING, threads naturally continue                │
 │                                                                         │
 │   Shutdown:                                                              │
 │   - running = false → all threads exit their loops                      │
 │   - gameLoopThread.join(), gravityThread.join(), etc.                   │
 │   - Clean exit, no daemon threads needed                                │
 │                                                                         │
 └─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┘

KEY DESIGN DECISIONS

  1. Why new Thread() instead of AnimationTimer/Timeline? Academic requirement: must demonstrate raw thread handling. AnimationTimer runs on the JavaFX Application Thread, blocking UI updates. Raw threads give explicit control over tick rates and pause/resume.
  2. Why ConcurrentLinkedQueue for input? Lock-free, thread-safe, O(1) enqueue/dequeue. Key presses happen on the JavaFX thread; processing happens on the game loop thread. No explicit synchronization needed between producer (UI) and consumer (game loop).
  3. Why Platform.runLater(Runnable) for rendering? JavaFX requires all UI updates on the Application Thread. The game loop computes new state on its own thread, then pushes a Runnable to the JavaFX thread for rendering, keeping computation and rendering decoupled.
  4. Why volatile for state flags? Simple visibility guarantee across threads without locks. GameState is read frequently but written rarely (pause/resume/end). volatile is sufficient because only visibility, not atomicity of compound operations, is needed.
  5. Why synchronized on Board modifications? Both the game loop thread and boss attack thread modify the Board. synchronized(board) prevents race conditions during trash line insertion while the game loop is processing line clears.

THREAD LIFECYCLE

 startGame() {
     state = PLAYING;
     running = true;
     gameLoopThread = new Thread(this::gameLoop);     gameLoopThread.start();
     gravityThread  = new Thread(this::gravityLoop);  gravityThread.start();
     bossAnimThread = new Thread(this::bossAnimLoop); bossAnimThread.start();
     bossAttackThread = new Thread(this::bossAttackLoop); bossAttackThread.start();
 }

 stopGame() {
     running = false;
     gameLoopThread.join();
     gravityThread.join();
     bossAnimThread.join();
     bossAttackThread.join();
 }

  • Constructor Details

    • GameController

      public GameController()
      Creates a new GameController in the GameState.MENU state with default values.

  • Method Details

    • startGame

      public void startGame()
      Initializes the model and starts all four game threads. Called when the player presses "Start" from the main menu.

    • stopGame

      public void stopGame()
      Stops all game threads by setting the master flag and interrupting each thread. Called on game over, win, or return to menu.

    • pauseGame

      public void pauseGame()
      Pauses the game. All threads will sleep-loop until resumed.

    • resumeGame

      public void resumeGame()
      Resumes the game from the paused state.

    • enqueueMoveLeft

      public void enqueueMoveLeft()
      Enqueues a "move left" action. Called on the JavaFX thread; the action is processed on the game loop thread.

    • enqueueMoveRight

      public void enqueueMoveRight()
      Enqueues a "move right" action. Called on the JavaFX thread; the action is processed on the game loop thread.

    • enqueueMoveDown

      public void enqueueMoveDown()
      Enqueues a "soft drop" (move down) action. Called on the JavaFX thread; the action is processed on the game loop thread.

    • enqueueRotateClockWise

      public void enqueueRotateClockWise()
      Enqueues a "rotate clock wise" action. Called on the JavaFX thread; the action is processed on the game loop thread.

    • enqueueRotateCounterClockWise

      public void enqueueRotateCounterClockWise()
      Enqueues a "rotate counter clock wise" action. Called on the JavaFX thread; the action is processed on the game loop thread.

    • enqueueHardDrop

      public void enqueueHardDrop()
      Enqueues a "hard drop" action. Called on the JavaFX thread; the action is processed on the game loop thread.

    • enqueueHold

      public void enqueueHold()
      Enqueues a "hold" action. Called on the JavaFX thread; the action is processed on the game loop thread.

      Returns:
      the tetromino in the hold slot, or null

    • getCurrentStage

      Returns:
      the current stage number (1–10)

      Returns:
      the player's cumulative score

      Returns:
      the current GameState

    • isRunning

      public boolean isRunning()
      Returns:
      true if threads are running

    • setRenderCallback

      public void setRenderCallback(Runnable callback)
      Sets the render callback invoked each game-loop tick.
      Parameters:
      callback - the render callback

    • setBossAnimCallback

      public void setBossAnimCallback(Runnable callback)
      Sets the callback for boss sprite animation updates.
      Parameters:
      callback - the boss animation callback

    • setOnGameEnd

      public void setOnGameEnd(Runnable callback)
      Sets the callback invoked when the game ends.
      Parameters:
      callback - the game-end callback
